learning_outcomes.description: Apply concepts for unsaturated soils to analyse mechanical, hydraulic, and environmental challenges.
Create stress-strain models for clays and sands.
Apply laboratory and field experiments to calibrate material models.
Evaluate assumptions for the representation of the mechanical behaviour of soils.
Analyse issues with soft and expansive soils.
Evaluate hydraulic principles of unsaturated soils.
Evaluate the impact of unsaturated soil mechanics in geotechnical engineering.
Analyse results from electrical resistivity tomography for soil characterisation.
Apply concepts of geophysics to provide solutions in geotechnical engineering.

assessments.task_description:
Solution of a geotechnical problem involving, but not limited to, the following topics: (a) Constitutive relationships parameterisation and analysis, (b) Laboratory testing, and (c) Critical state soil mechanics. Only a few critical numerical results are required to be input via an online form. The problem definition and required results will be specified in a PDF file posted on Blackboard as the semester progresses.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. 

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The link to the online form will be specified in the PDF file posted on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Solution of a geotechnical problem involving, but not limited to, the following topics: (a) Common challenges with soils, (b) Analysis of unsaturated and problematic soils, (c) Soft and problematic soils, and (d) Physical principles and hydraulics. Only a few critical numerical results are required to be input via an online form. The problem definition and required results will be specified in a PDF file posted on Blackboard as the semester progresses.

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance. 

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The link to the online form will be specified in the PDF file posted on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The final exam will include short answer questions about materials modelling, unsaturated soils, and geophysics.

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

Introduction

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 5(04 Aug - 31 Aug)
learning_activities.topic:
Continuum mechanics and materials modelling

Fundamentals of materials modelling and testing. Introduction to continuum mechanics, elasticity, and plasticity.


Learning outcomes: L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Continuum mechanics and materials modelling Fundamentals of materials modelling and testing. Introduction to continuum mechanics, elasticity, and plasticity.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 3 To Week 12(11 Aug - 26 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Tutorials

A set of tutorials will be defined in three parts covering: (1) materials modelling, (2) unsaturated soils, and (3) geophysics.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07, L08, L09
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorials A set of tutorials will be defined in three parts covering: (1) materials modelling, (2) unsaturated soils, and (3) geophysics.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 6 To Week 9(01 Sep - 28 Sep)
learning_activities.topic:
Unsaturated soils

Introduction to unsaturated, soft, and expansive soils. Physical principles, hydraulics, and case studies.


Learning outcomes: L05, L06, L07
learning_activities.topic_description: Unsaturated soils Introduction to unsaturated, soft, and expansive soils. Physical principles, hydraulics, and case studies.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 10 To Week 12(06 Oct - 26 Oct)
learning_activities.topic:
Geophysics

Introduction to geophysics, electrical resistivity tomography for soil characterisation, induced polarization, and complex conductivity.
